drinkName.name: Maison Premiere Sazerac
drinkName.about: Try this simple twist on the classic Sazerac recipe.

mix.how: Add a few ice cubes and the absinthe to a double rocks glass.
Stir a few times, liberally splashing the sides of the glass.
Tilt the glass so the absinthe reaches the rim and turn slowly to coat the entire glass.
Discard the ice and excess absinthe, and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass.
Garnish with lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Whiskey Smash
drinkName.about: Like Mint Juleps? You’ll love the Whiskey Smash, a citrusy 19th-century cooler. Legendary bartender Dale DeGroff at the Rainbow Room in New York modified the classic recipe by adding muddled lemon wedges. DeGroff calls the citrus-and-mint combination the perfect cocktail for those who say they’ll never drink whiskey.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice or one large ice chunk.
Slap a mint sprig between your hands and use as garnish.
Serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: VEEV Basil Gimlet
drinkName.about: Add some herbal freshness to the classic lime cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Float a basil leaf on top of the drink.

drinkName.name: Flying Dutchman
drinkName.about: Three different herb-infused spirits flavor this easy-to-make cocktail with complex flavors.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled large cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Sweet Tea Smash
drinkName.about: Fix this summery cocktail and then find a nearby porch to sip it on.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon wedges and mint leaves.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

drinkName.name: Pharaoh Cooler
drinkName.about: Looking for a refreshing drink? Try this tequila, watermelon and grenadine cooler.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Fill with chilled club soda.

drinkName.name: Shifting Sands
drinkName.about: This tasty gin and citrus cocktail comes from master mixologist Sasha Petraske.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

drinkName.name: Gypsy Queen
drinkName.about: One of the earliest vodka-cocktail recipes created in the US, this simple tipple dates back to 1938.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel over the top and discard.

drinkName.name: 24 Sour
drinkName.about: Pucker up for this gin, Bénédictine and lemon juice combo.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with an orange wedge and cherry.

drinkName.name: Betsy Ross
drinkName.about: No, the famed flag-maker Betsy Ross did not create this brandy- and port-based tipple. But it’s delicious nonetheless.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Rhode Island Red
drinkName.about: The smallest state in the union is the namesake for this big-time tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with crushed ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a splash of ginger beer and garnish with lemon and lime zest.

drinkName.name: Fall and Summer
drinkName.about: Toast the seasons with this tasty tequila cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle all the ingredients except the Ginger Syrup.
Add the Ginger Syrup and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice or a highball glass without ice.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Berri Ricky
drinkName.about: A fruity version of an old classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Stir, and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Chilcano
drinkName.about: The refreshing snap of lime and pisco with the fizz of ginger ale is what makes the Chilcano delicious.

mix.how: Add the pisco and lime juice to a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with ginger ale and add the bitters.
Garnish with a lime twist.

drinkName.name: Aviation
drinkName.about: Noted for its beautiful color, this old-school gin Aviation cocktail is as blue as the sky. Created before Prohibition, this staple was lost to the United States after the Noble Experiment. Luckily, the return of lots of classic liqueurs and quality spirits put this cocktail back on the market.

ingredients.ingredient: Crème de violette or Crème Yvette

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: The Basil Fizz
drinkName.about: Bourbon and Champagne make beautiful music together.

mix.how: Add Basil Hayden's Bourbon and Champagne to a flute.

drinkName.name: Absinthe Drip
drinkName.about: Enjoy the once-illicit absinthe in an old-fashioned Absinthe Drip.

mix.how: Fill an absinthe fountain with ice water.

Pour the absinthe into an absinthe glass and place an absinthe spoon topped with the sugar cube across the rim. Position the glass under a spigot of the fountain and slowly drip water over the sugar cube until the sugar dissolves and the absinthe turns completely opaque.
(You will need roughly 5 ounces of water per ounce of absinthe).
Stir briefly before serving.

drinkName.name: Winter Sour
drinkName.about: This delicious low-alcohol cocktail recipe is bitter, sweet and seasonal.

ingredients.ingredient: Clover honey syrup (1 part clover honey, 1 part simple syrup)

mix.how: Strip the leaves from the rosemary sprig and add them to a shaker.
Muddle, and then add the Meyer lemon juice and egg white.
Shake without ice for 5 seconds.
Add the Campari and honey syrup and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a short rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Whatamelon
drinkName.about: This watermelon cooler is perfect for a day at the beach.

ingredients.ingredient: Bright, crisp white wine, such as Sauternes or verdejo (optional)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the watermelon juice or cubes and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint leaf slapped between your palms.

drinkName.name: The Tender Knob
drinkName.about: Apple, bourbon and cinnamon create the perfect autumn tipple.

ingredients.ingredient: Organic Granny Smith or Fuji Apple (eighth inch)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the apple slice.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
(Do not double-strain; you want some apple bits in the finished drink).
Garnish with an additional apple slice.

drinkName.name: Red, White & Night
drinkName.about: Celebrate the Fourth of July year-round with this ruby-red punch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strin into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with 3 blueberries or black raspberries coated in powdered sugar.

drinkName.name: The Murphy Sour
drinkName.about: Try this citrusy twist on the classic South American Pisco Sour.

ingredients.ingredient: Clover honey syrup (one part clover honey, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cilantro and clementine.
Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice for 5 seconds.
Fill with ice and shake well.
Double-strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a cilantro sprig.

drinkName.name: Front Porch Swing
drinkName.about: In this refreshing Sangria variation, vodka and elderflower play off the bright flavors of fruit and white wine.

ingredients.ingredient: Square One Cucumber Vodka or Square One Botanical Spirit
White wine (sauvignon blanc, Sancerre, albariño or verdejo)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill three-quarters of the way with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds and pour (unstrained) into a large wine glass.
Garnish with a mint or tarragon sprig.

drinkName.name: Manhattan
drinkName.about: The Manhattan was the most famous cocktail in the world shortly after it was invented in New York City’s Manhattan Club, some time around 1880 (as the story goes). Over the years, the whiskey classic has dipped in and out of fashion before finding its footing as one of the cornerstones of the craft cocktail renaissance.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice, and stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: Kyoto Sour
drinkName.about: Sake isn’t just for sipping. Try this spicy cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the grapefruit and Tabasco.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice and a fresh mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Smash & Grab
drinkName.about: You don’t need a crowbar to fix this tasty bourbon cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, lightly muddle the orange, mint and simple syrup.
Add the bourbon and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and double-strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: No. 3 French 75
drinkName.about: The bubbly French 75 is perfect for celebrating a large or a small occasion.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Fill with Champagne and garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: Dale’s Rainbow Planter’s Punch
drinkName.about: An instant-party-in-a-punchbowl for six, dreamed up by cocktail legend Dale DeGroff.

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients in a large pitcher or bowl.
Before serving, shake individual drinks in a shaker with ice and strain into punch cups or large goblets filled three-quarters of the way with ice.
Garnish each drink with pineapple, orange, and lime slices.

drinkName.name: Boat House Punch
drinkName.about: The citrusy, bubbly Boat House Punch is both gorgeous and delicious.

mix.how: In a large pitcher, muddle the lemon peel and sugar.
Let stand for at least 30 minutes.
Add the remaining ingredients, fill with ice and stir briefly.
Garnish with orange wheels.

drinkName.name: Maker’s Mark Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: Muddled fruit gives this version of the classic Old Fashioned an extra kick of sweetness.

mix.how: In an Old Fashioned glass, muddle the orange, cherry and sugar.
Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and add the bourbon and club soda.
Garnish with an additional orange wheel and maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Caipirinha
drinkName.about: Our classic Caipirinha recipe instantly transports you to a beach in Rio.

mix.how: To make a Caipirinha first, in a double Old Fashioned glass, muddle the sugar and lime.
Fill with ice and add the cachaça.
Stir briefly and garnish with a lime wheel if desired.

drinkName.name: Gentleman’s Press
drinkName.about: The simplest pairings are often the most satisfying. A perfect showcase for Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey, The Gentleman’s Press melds naturally with the bubbly freshness of ginger beer and a hint of lime.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Stir briefly and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Jalisco Flor
drinkName.about: Mix up this flower of a cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and garnish with a few orange slices.

drinkName.name: Duke’s Martini
drinkName.about: This classic Martini uses a classic London dry-style gin.

mix.how: Chill the gin and a cocktail glass in the freezer for at least two hours.
Add the gin and vermouth to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the frozen cocktail glass.
Garnish with a slice of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Ginger Smash
drinkName.about: A delicious mix of three spirits, pineapple, lime juice and, of course, ginger.

mix.how: Muddle the pineapple, ginger and sugar in a shaker until they form a paste.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill halfway with ice.
Shake briefly and pour (unstrained) into a rocks or Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a pineapple leaf.

drinkName.name: Wild Turkey Mint Tea
drinkName.about: Try this summertime favorite with a bourbon punch.

mix.how: In a large saucepan, boil 2 cups of water and the sugar.
Remove from the heat and add the tea bags.
Steep for 8 minutes and then discard the bags.
Add the remaining 2 cups of water.
Transfer to a pitcher and chill.
Add the mint and crush with a wooden spoon until fragrant.
Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Serve in tall glasses filled with ice.
Garnish each glass with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Yerba Buena
drinkName.about: Mojito + ginger beer = refreshing and delicious.

mix.how: In a highball glass, muddle the mint, lime juice and agave nectar.
Add the tequila and fill with ice.
Top with ginger beer and stir.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Caribeño
drinkName.about: Go tropical with this coconut water, lime and rum drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Squeeze a lime wedge into the glass and drop it in the drink.

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s Bloody Mary
drinkName.about: A bourbon Bloody Mary? Try this unusual concoction for brunch.

mix.how: Rub the lime wedge around the rim of a pint glass and coat with celery salt.
Fill with ice and add 2 dashes of celery salt and the remaining ingredients except the tomato juice.
Fill with tomato juice and stir well.
Garnish with a celery stalk, lime wedge and blue cheese-stuffed olives.

drinkName.name: Gimlet
drinkName.about: Who says medicine can’t taste amazing? This essential cocktail was created for sailors as a way to prevent scurvy. It didn’t take long to realize that this preventative drink was also delicious. While scurvy may be of the past, it seems like this tart tipple is here to stay. It doesn’t get much simpler or more refreshing than the classic Gimlet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
(You can substitute 1 oz lime cordial, such as Rose's Lime Juice, for both the lime juice and simple syrup).

drinkName.name: Chambord Kir Royale
drinkName.about: The Kir Royale is a swanky Champagne and black raspberry cocktail that is sure to class up your night. The subtle twist on the fruity French Kir Royale combines Champagne and black raspberry liqueur, rather than the traditional creme de cassis. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or need a bubbly brunch drink, mix up this swanky recipe for the Kir Royale.

mix.how: Add the Chambord to a flute and top with Champagne.
Garnish with a raspberry and a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Karlsson’s Summer Bloody Mary
drinkName.about: This spicy, gingery spin on the brunch classic is perfect for a warm day.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Collins glass with a mixture of sea salt and black pepper.
Fill with ice and add the remaining ingredients.
Stir to combine and garnish with a lemon wedge, olive, cocktail onion and celery stalk.

drinkName.name: Rosie Lee
drinkName.about: Gin, rose petals and exotic lychee team up to make this tasty, summery tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a teacup filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Herradura Tequila Mojito
drinkName.about: The short trip from Cuba to Mexico makes for a drastic change in flavor for the classic Mojito. Blending mint and tequila, this warm weather drink is an excellent Cinco de Mayo cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint leaves.
Add the tequila, lime juice and agave nectar, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda.

drinkName.name: Dutchman’s Daiquiri
drinkName.about: Genever, lime and a chile pepperapparently they like it spicy in Holland.

ingredients.ingredient: Red chile pepper, seeded and sliced
Rich sugar syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the chile.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a red chile pepper.

drinkName.name: Royal Smash
drinkName.about: Drink like a blue blood for the evening.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint and lemon.
Add the Royal Combier and fill with ice.
Shake hard and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Bourbon Lift
drinkName.about: The cocktail equivalent of a New York egg cream, this rich and fizzy bourbon drink is absolutely delicious.

ingredients.ingredient: House Spirits Coffee Liqueur or other coffee liqueur

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds and double-strain into an 8-ounce Fizz or Collins glass.
Fill with club soda, pouring from about 6 inches above the glass.
Wait a few seconds and then add another splash of soda�-this will �"lift�" the foam above the top of the glass.
Serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: La Estrella
drinkName.about: This spicy and sweet cocktail will have you seeing stars.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cubes and 1 oz of the club soda until they dissolve.
Add several 1-inch pieces of watermelon and muddle again.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into a snifter with one large ice cube inside.
Top with the remaining 2 oz club soda and garnish with a pineapple slice and a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Off to the Races
drinkName.about: Homemade peach-apricot-chipotle syrup takes this drink way beyond the Julep.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the shiso leaves.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and double-strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a shiso leaf.

drinkName.name: Ginger Ale Highball
drinkName.about: The spicy notes of rye whiskey and ginger pair beautifully in the simple and classic Ginger Ale Highball.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with ice and add the whiskey.
Fill with ginger ale.

drinkName.name: Gin Buck
drinkName.about: The simple, sweet and bubbly Gin Buck was a popular summer cooler during the Roaring ’20s.

ingredients.ingredient: Juice of half a lemon or lime

mix.how: Fill a Collins glass with ice and add the gin and lemon or lime juice.
Fill with ginger ale and stir briefly.
Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Rosemary & Rhubarb
drinkName.about: Rhubarb’s uniquely tart flavor is an ideal backbone for this complex vodka cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an apple fan on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Bushmills Black Bush The Black Nail
drinkName.about: A long name for a simple drink.

mix.how: Add Bushmills Irish Whiskey and Irish Mist to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Sazerac
drinkName.about: A close cousin to the Old Fashioned, the Sazerac has been kicking around in one form or another since 1840. In 2008, it was crowned the official cocktail of New Orleans, a designation more suited to marketers than drink mixers. The truth is the Sazerac has always belonged to the Crescent City.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe, discarding any excess, and set aside.
In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cube, water and both bitters.
Add the rye, fill with ice, and stir until well-chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Twist a slice of lemon peel over the surface to extract the oils and then discard.

drinkName.name: St-Germain Cocktail
drinkName.about: The fizzy elderflower-and-wine cocktail has become a modern classic. You simply need a measure St-Germain elderflower liqueur, some Champagne to cut the sweetness and soda to make it ultra-refreshing.

mix.how: Add the St-Germain and wine to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Stir well and top with club soda.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Distrito Federal (AKA Tequila Manhattan)
drinkName.about: Named for Mexico’s largest city, this is an aged-tequila twist on the classic Manhattan.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime twist or a cherry.

drinkName.name: Summer Rye
drinkName.about: It’s also good for winter, spring and fall.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tumbler filled with fresh ice.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with some apple cubes.

drinkName.name: Pyrat Punch
drinkName.about: Hoist one to the skull and bones. Arrr!

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake gently and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the soda and garnish with grated nutmeg and cherries.

drinkName.name: Grand Marnier’s Smash
drinkName.about: Grand Marnier’s Smash is so simple but so refreshing.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon and mint.
Add the Grand Marnier and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Port Royal Punch
drinkName.about: Throwing a big party? This tropical spiced rum punch recipe serves 25.

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl or large pitcher and stir.
Serve in punch glasses filled with ice.

drinkName.name: The Bowery
drinkName.about: The tasty ginger liqueur Domaine de Canton doesn’t need much dressing up.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Ruby Partida
drinkName.about: Mix up this tequila, cassis and grapefruit cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the cassis to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Dribble the .5 oz of French Cassis down the inside of the glass so it settles at the bottom.

drinkName.name: The Lanesborough
drinkName.about: A sparkling cocktail that’s a big step up from a Mimosa.

mix.how: Add the Grand Marnier, cranberry juice and passion fruit juice or puree to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange spiral twist.

drinkName.name: House-made Clover Club
drinkName.about: Turn leftover jam into a delicious drink with the Clover Club cocktail.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker with ice, shake and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: USS Richmond Punch
drinkName.about: All hands on deck for the historic quadruple-liquor USS Richmond Punch.

ingredients.ingredient: Strong-brewed black tea (use 2 teabags, 16 oz water)
Dark Jamaican rum (Smith & Cross or Myers’s, 16 oz)

mix.how: Place a 2- or 3-quart bowl of water in the freezer and let freeze overnight.
Peel 6 lemons with a swivel-bladed vegetable peeler, trying not to get any of the white pith.
In bowl, muddle the peels with 1.5 cups of superfine sugar and let stand for an hour for the lemon oil to leach out.
Juice the peeled lemons and add the juice to the sugar mixture, along with the tea.
Strain out the peels and pour into a 1-gallon container.
Add the rum, cognac, port and Grand Marnier, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
To serve, unmold the block of ice into a 2-gallon punch bowl.
Add the chilled punch stock and top off with the club soda (or, if feeling dangerous, Champagne).
Garnish with grated numeg and 1 seeded lemon sliced thinly.
Serves 20.

drinkName.name: Mayahuel
drinkName.about: A great orange-and-ginger twist on the classic Margarita.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part agave nectar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a wine glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Virgin Ad Lib
drinkName.about: This herb-and-lemon concoction is a recipe you can share with the kids.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the of cilantro.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
(If you're not a fan of cilantro, try this recipe with mint, basil or any soft herb.).

drinkName.name: Colony Records
drinkName.about: This fruity and spiced concoction is perfect for holiday entertaining.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Holiday at the Hive
drinkName.about: This citrus and honey elixir is a perfectly refreshing way to kick off a party.

mix.how: Add the honey and hot water to a shaker and stir to dissolve.
Add the remaining ingredients, shake vigorously and strain into a Martini glass.

drinkName.name: The Dead Rabbit Irish Coffee
drinkName.about: We got famed New York bar The Dead Rabbit to share its recipe for delicious hot Irish Coffee.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Fill an Irish Coffee glass with hot water and let stand for a few minutes to warm.
Pour out the water and add the Demerara syrup, whiskey and coffee.
Stir to combine and top with a layer of heavy cream the width of your thumb.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Hearn
drinkName.about: This complex Irish whiskey-based spin on the Manhattan won’t fail to impress.

ingredients.ingredient: Knappogue Castle 12 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist a slice of orange peel over the drink to release the oils and discard the peel.

drinkName.name: Bourbon, Vanilla & Chocolate Milkshake
drinkName.about: You’ll never look at ice cream the same way again.

ingredients.ingredient: Premium vanilla ice cream, plus more if needed

mix.how: Place 4 heavy pint glasses in the freezer to chill for 30 minutes.
Add the ice cream, milk, ice cubes, bourbon and 4 tbsp of the chocolate syrup to a powerful blender.
Blend until smooth.
(A good milkshake should be eaten with a spoon, so if the mixture seems too thin, add another .25 to .5 cup ice cream and blend again.).
Divide evenly among the prepared glasses and top each with .5 tbsp of the remaining chocolate syrup.
Serve immediately.

drinkName.name: Magic Hour
drinkName.about: Celebrate in style with this fizzy aperitif.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Blushing Lady
drinkName.about: She may seem demure, but she packs a powerful punch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: 1942 Martini
drinkName.about: A really good tequila can make a really good Martini.

mix.how: Add all the ingredient to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Maneki-Tini
drinkName.about: Enjoy Japanese whisky’s sweeter side.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled Martini glass, and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Oatmeal-Infused Karlsson’s Gold Vodka
drinkName.about: Used in other recipes such as the Pumpkin & Spice.

drinkName.name: Grand Tea
drinkName.about: You’ll wish that it was always tea time.

mix.how: Add the ingredients to a pitcher and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with lemon wheels.

drinkName.name: Don Julio Colada
drinkName.about: You don’t have to drink this out of a coconut shell, but…

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice. Blend until smooth.
Pour into a hollowed-out coconut shell or a mug and garnish with cherries and coconut shavings.

drinkName.name: East India Negroni
drinkName.about: A transatlantic twist on the classic aperitif.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with one large ice cube.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: C & B Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: C for Campari; B for Benedictine.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir very well and strain into an old fashioned glass full of fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Aperol Flip
drinkName.about: This Champagne and Aperol combo is frothy, fizzy and sophisticated.

mix.how: Add the Aperol, lemon juice, simple syrup and egg white to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake until well-chilled and frothy.
Pour the Champagne into a Martini glass.
Strain the Aperol mixture into the glass.
Pinch the strip of orange zest to release its oil into the glass and then lay it atop the foam.

drinkName.name: Açaí Mojito
drinkName.about: What’s better than one super-fruit cocktail? A whole pitcher.

mix.how: In a pitcher, muddle the mint.
Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and add the VeeV, simple syrup, lime juice and blueberry puree.
Stir well and top with club soda.
Garnish with blueberries.

drinkName.name: Irish Coffee
drinkName.about: The secrets to making a great Irish Coffee are really so simple that they are often overlooked. This hot, creamy, classic Irish Coffee recipe from legendary bartender Dale DeGroff has all the right ingredients and will warm you to the bone.

mix.how: Add the whiskey and syrup to an Irish Coffee glass and fill two-thirds of the way with coffee.
Top with one inch of whipped cream.

drinkName.name: Irish Jack Rose
drinkName.about: The classic Jack Rose cocktail gets a splash of Irish whiskey.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Shamrock Sour
drinkName.about: No leprechauns were hurt in the making of this recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part agave nectar, one part water)
Egg white (that is about half of an egg white)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and shake again.
Strain into a double rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Dry Martini
drinkName.about: The Dry Martini is a classic cocktail that, like a tailored suit, is timeless. Although the original of the tipple is unclear, the Dry Martini has maintained a place in cocktail history due to being easy to use and endlessly sophisticated. Elegant for the fancy and boozy for the heavy-handed, this potation is truly the everyman’s cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until very cold.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Italian Grape Sour
drinkName.about: This sweet drink makes a strong case for using grape juice in cocktails.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and two grapes on a cocktail pick or skewer.

drinkName.name: Pony Express
drinkName.about: Hitch a ride on this rye whiskey, lemon juice and white tea liqueur cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake hard and strain the drink into a 12 oz bucket glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Basil Margarita
drinkName.about: A refreshing twist on the classic.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries, basil, lime juice and simple syrup.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a Margarita glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel and additional basil leaf.

drinkName.name: Mango Brava Daiquiri
drinkName.about: Find out what happens when you add mango to an all-time classic.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: McKinley’s Delight
drinkName.about: McKinley’s Delight was created in 1896 to celebrate the 25th president’s electionthis lost classic is a spin on the Manhattan. Many presidents had cocktails created in their honor, but few have stood the test of time. Created in 1896 during the 25th president’s election, the McKinley’s Delight is an exception. It incorporates classic elements from the Manhattan, but dresses them up for the special occasion with cherry liqueur and a dash of absinthe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Cut a thin swatch of lemon peel, twist over the drink and discard.

drinkName.name: Cannibal Corpse Reviver No. 2
drinkName.about: A few dashes of pear brandy and Fernet-Branca make this gin cocktail recipe unique.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the prosecco to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with chilled prosecco and garnish with a lemon half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Rusty Nail
drinkName.about: According to cocktail historian David Wondrich, the Rusty Nail made its first appearance in 1937, and it wasn’t long before it became a classic. Don’t worry—there’s no need for a tetanus shot after drinking one of these.

ingredients.ingredient:
Scotch
Try it with Chivas Regal

mix.how: Add the ingredients into a rocks glass with ice and stir.

drinkName.name: Antiguo Citrus Mint Squeeze
drinkName.about: A little sour, a little sweet, a little fizzy and a lot of tequila.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the grapefruit, lime and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge, lime wedge and mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Tom Collins
drinkName.about: The Tom Collins is such a classic they named the glass after it.

ingredients.ingredient:
London dry gin
Try it with Beefeater

mix.how: Add the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup to a Collins glass.
Fill with ice, top with club soda and stir.
Garnish with 2 lemon slices.

drinkName.name: White Sangria
drinkName.about: All that fruit is good for you; have another glass of this delicious White Sangria.

ingredients.ingredient: Ripe peaches, pitted and cut into eight wedges

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a pitcher and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours before serving.
Serve in wine glasses.

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s Apple Bubbly
drinkName.about: Bourbon, apples and bubbles. Oh my!

mix.how: Add the bourbon to a Champagne flute and fill with sparkling apple juice.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Dukes Gin Classic Martini
drinkName.about: This classic cocktail is the house Martini at London’s Dukes Hotel, where James Bond creator Ian Fleming was a regular.

mix.how: Chill the gin, vermouth and a Martini glass in the freezer.
Add both ingredients to the glass and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon twist.
